comments.body: Are these pins needed to be so tight?

In theory yes.

We want this metapackage to provide everything users need to run a specific version of "Cylc". In the past, there was only `cylc`, which is now `cylc-flow`. We decided to match the version of the old package, so the metapackage version matches the `cylc-flow` release, so users are not confused.

This version of the Cylc metapackage should include

- `cylc-flow` with the same version
- `cylc-uiserver-0.1`, which handles GraphQL backend queries, and communication with `cylc-flow`
- `cylc-ui-0.1`, the JS application that initiates the calls

If users install everything as pinned above, it should work. If they install `cylc-ui ==0.2`, our next release of the UI, there is no guarantee it will work with the other dependencies. In fact, we know it shouldn't work as 0.2 has WebSockets, that is not implemented in `cylc-uiserver ==0.1`.

So for our next Cylc release 8.0a2 we will bump these pinned dependencies accordingly, so that users can `conda install cylc` and have the correct versions in their environments.

Hope that makes sense. This is our first release to Conda, as you can tell from our 0.1 versions, so happy to change it if you have suggestions for other ways to achieve something similar, or if this strict version requirement is an issue.

Thanks!
It is up to you as the maintainer.  You will have to updated these pins manually at every release. But if you are OK with that...
You can also always change this in the feedstock

Thanks @scopatz 

For now we will probably keep these strict dependency requirements.

But once we have the initial 1.0.x release of each component, we will probably update it to something like `1.0.*` or `1.*`/

Thanks!
